verses.verse: In the beginning, there was the Message, the Message was close to God, and the Message was God.
This Message was close to God in the beginning.
All things came into existence through Him, and separate from Him not even one thing came into existence that has come into existence.
In Him, there was life, and the life was the light of the people.
And the light shines in the dark, and the dark did not take it down.
There became a person who had been sent out on a mission from the side of God. The name belonging to him is John.
This person came for a witness account, so that he might tell what he witnessed about the Light, so that all might trust through him.
That person was not the Light, but he came so that he might tell what he witnessed about the Light.
The Light (the true One that illuminates every person) was coming into the world.
He was in the world, the world came into existence through Him, and the world did not know Him.
He went to His own places, and His own people did not receive Him in.
But as many as received Him, to them He gave authority to become God's children, to the people trusting in His name
who were born, not from blood, nor from what a physical body wants, nor from what a man wants, but from God.
And the Message became a physical body and camped among us. And we viewed His magnificence, magnificence as of the only biological child from the side of the Father, full of generosity and truth.
John tells what he witnessed about Him, and he has yelled, saying, "This was whom I said, 'The One coming behind me has become in front of me because He was first before me.'"
And we all received from His fullness, even generosity for generosity.
Because the law was given through Moses, the generosity and the truth happened through Jesus, the Anointed King.
No one has seen God at any time. The only biological Son, the One being in the arms of the Father, that One recounted Him.
And this is the witness account of John when the Jewish people from Greater Jerusalem sent out priests and Levites so that they might ask him, "Who are you?"
And he acknowledged. And he did not deny. And he acknowledged, "I am not the Anointed King."
And they asked him, "So who are you? Are you Elijah?" And he says, "I am not." "Are you the Preacher?" And he answered, "No."
So they said to him, "Who are you? So that we might give a response to the people who sent us. What do you say about yourself?"
He was declaring, "I am a voice shouting in the backcountry, 'Make the road of the Master straight,' just as Isaiah, the preacher, said." (in Isaiah 40:3)
And the people who had been sent out were from the Separatists.
And they asked him and said to him, "So why do you submerge if you are not the Anointed King, nor Elijah, nor the Preacher?"
John answered them, saying, "I submerge in water. But in the middle of you, He has stood, whom you have not seen.
He is the One coming behind me, who has become in front of me, of whom I am not deserving that I might release the strap of His sandal."
These things happened in Bethabara on the other side of the Jordan River where John was submerging.
The next day, John sees Jesus coming to him and says, "Look, the Lamb of God, the One taking away the sin of the world.
It is this One about whom I said, 'Behind me, a Man is coming who has become in front of me because He was first before me.'
And I had not seen Him, but I had seen that He would be shown to Israel. Because of this, I came submerging in the water."
And John told what he witnessed, saying, "I have viewed the Spirit stepping down as if He were a dove from heaven, and He stayed on Him.

And I had not seen Him, but the One who sent me to be submerging in water, that One said to me, 'On whomever you see the Spirit stepping down and staying on Him, this One is the One who submerges in the Sacred Spirit.'
And I have seen and told what I witnessed, that this is the Son of God."
The next day, again, John and two from his students had been standing.
And when he looks at Jesus traipsing around, he says, "Look, the Lamb of God!"
And the two students listened to him speaking, and they followed Jesus.

When Jesus turns around and sees them following, He says to them, "What are you looking for?" The two said to Him, "Rabbi," (that is said in place of Teacher, being interpreted from Hebrew), "where are You staying?"
He says to them, "Come and see." They went and saw where He stays and stayed beside Him that day. The hour was as if it were the tenth (4:00 p. m.).
Andrew (the brother of Simon Peter) was one from the two, the two who heard from the side of John and followed Him.
This first man finds the brother, his own, Simon, and says to him, "We have found the Messiah," (that is translated from Hebrew as the Anointed King).
And he led him to Jesus. When Jesus looked at him, He said, "You are Simon, the son of Jonah. You will be called Cephas" (Aramaic for Peter, that is interpreted rock).
The next day Jesus wanted to go out into Galilee. And He finds Philip and says to him, "Follow Me."
Philip was out of Bethsaida, from the city of Andrew and Peter.
Philip finds Nathanael and says to him, "Whom Moses in the Law and the Preachers wrote about, we have found, Jesus, the son of Joseph, the one out of Nazareth."
And Nathanael said to him, "What good thing is able to be from Nazareth?" Philip says to him, "Come and see."
Jesus saw Nathanael coming to Him and says concerning him, "Look, an Israeli in whom is truly no deception."
Nathanael says to Him, "Where do You know me from?" Jesus answered and said to him, "Before the time for Philip to holler to you, being under the fig tree, I saw you."
Nathanael responded and says to Him, "Rabbi, You are the Son of God. You are the King of Israel."
Jesus responded and said to him, "Because I said to you, 'I saw you beneath the fig tree, do you trust?' You will see greater things than these."
And He says to him, "Amen, amen, I tell you, from now on you will see the heaven having opened and the angels of God stepping up and stepping down on the Son of the Person."
